H0.text: What type of bird is often depicted with an olive branch in its beak. Sparrow

H1.text: What type of bird is often depicted with an olive branch in its beak. Finch

H2.text: What type of bird is often depicted with an olive branch in its beak. Swan

H3.text: What type of bird is often depicted with an olive branch in its beak. Dove

A4.text: The dove is often depicted with an olive branch in its beak in early Christian art.

A5.text: In the Catacomb of Priscilla, there is a depiction of a dove with a branch flying to a figure marked as Eirene (Peace).
